verse: किं ब्रूमस्त्वां यशोदे कति कति सुकृतक्षेत्रवृन्दानि पूर्वम् गत्वा कीदृग् विधानैः कति कति सुकृतान्यर्जितानित्वयैव । नो शक्रो न स्वयम्भूर्न च मदनरिपुर्यस्य लेभे प्रसादम् तत् पूर्णं ब्रह्म भूमौ विलुठति विलपत्क्रोडमारोढुकामम् ॥
overall_meaning: What can we say to you, Yashoda, about the countless fields of good deeds you had previously earned? In what way, by how many means, have you earned countless good deeds solely by yourself? Not even Indra, nor Brahma, nor the enemy of Madana (Shiva), attained such favor. That complete Brahman wails distressed in the world, crying in distress like a crore of distressed beings.
